options.option_text: Useful Data has been mentioned above.
This data attachment is just for a reference & not for an evaluation.

questions.question_text_1: Suppose that the number of miles that a car can run before its battery wears out is exponentially distributed, with an average value of 10,000 miles. If you desire to take a 5,000-mile trip, what is the probability that you will be able to complete the trip without replacing the car battery?
question_texts: Suppose that the number of miles that a car can run before its battery wears out is exponentially distributed, with an average value of 10,000 miles. If you desire to take a 5,000-mile trip, what is the probability that you will be able to complete the trip without replacing the car battery?
